title: Introducing: FRAME
content:
Brooklyn’s FRAME (Caitlin Frame) cropped up towards the beginning of the year, with her debut outing Run Around, a Fleetwood Mac indebted power-pop number, that for some reason (my own laziness, most likely) slipped under my radar.

With a new track premiering on DIY last week, she’s well and truly forced her way back into my field of vision, and really clicked this time. New cut, Polarizer feels hugely Blondie influenced, alongside the likes of The Pretenders and The B-52’s; two and a half minutes, straight to the point, yet endearingly glamorous pop. These two tracks alone indicate an electrifying live show.
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
